response.answer_text: I am not sure what you mean. Electricity is not so much used as it is borrowed. An electrochemical, electromechanical, photoelectric, thermoelectric or electromagnetic event creates a charge displacement to can be used for to many purposes to name. The charge displacement eventually just goes back to its resting state. I am sure I have forgotten a way make electricity and I am not going to try to name all of the ways to use it.

I use electricity for lighting my house, for cooking, for refrigeration, air conditioning, the fan on my gas furnace, my electric bicycle, to save gas in my Prius, my electric lawn mower, my string cutter, my electric saws, my electric drill, my flashlights, TV, computer, tablet and cell phone. Also, electricity sends signals along the neurons of my brain.
